private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks.
I can only move one top block at a time.
The vowel blocks in this scenario are A, E, I, O.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange blocks so that they form the target stack ordering specified in the public goal.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks.
I can only move one top block at a time.
The consonant blocks in this scenario are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange blocks so that they form the target stack ordering specified in the public goal.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their partial plans into a final PDDL domain and problem.
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a single coherent PDDL domain and problem that, when solved by FastDownwards, achieves the global stacking goal.

public_information: There are fifteen blocks labeled L, E, K, G, I, F, A, H, B, N, C, D, O, M, J.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved at a time.
Any move consists of taking a top block from its stack and placing it onto another block or onto the table.
Each agent can interact with only one block at a time.
The vowel agent may only move vowel blocks. The consonant agent may only move consonant blocks.
Initial configuration: L is on the table.
E is on the table.
K is on top of L.
G is on the table.
I is on top of K.
F is on top of G.
A is on top of F.
H is on top of I.
B is on top of A.
N is on top of H.
C is on top of E.
D is on top of C.
O is on top of D.
M is on top of O.
J is on top of B.

Public goal: achieve the target stacking where A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, K is on top of L, L is on top of M, M is on top of N, N is on top of O, and O is on the table.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that can move only vowel-labeled blocks. Based on the public information, identify which vowel blocks are currently movable (i.e., are at the top of a stack) and produce a partial sequence of allowed actions involving only vowel blocks. Do not produce PDDL. Describe moves in terms of source and destination, for example: move A from top_of F to top_of B or to table. If information is missing that prevents you from proposing a safe move, indicate the missing information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. The environment public information is available as {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The overall goal is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a clear partial plan listing only moves you are allowed to perform with vowel blocks, and indicate any assumptions or missing details. Think step by step.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that can move only consonant-labeled blocks. Based on the public information, identify which consonant blocks are currently movable (i.e., are at the top of a stack) and produce a partial sequence of allowed actions involving only consonant blocks. Do not produce PDDL. Describe moves in terms of source and destination, for example: move B from top_of A to top_of C or to table. If information is missing that prevents you from proposing a safe move, indicate the missing information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. The environment public information is available as {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The overall goal is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a clear partial plan listing only moves you are allowed to perform with consonant blocks, and indicate any assumptions or missing details. Think step by step.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating partial plans from the vowel and consonant agents into a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that model the block-moving capabilities of both agents, keeping their allowed actions distinct and respecting that each agent can only move top blocks and only blocks of their permitted letter class. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards and includes necessary typing, predicates, actions, initial state, and goal.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the partial outputs from two agents and must integrate them into a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards. The public environment information is {environment->public_information}. The first agent response is {partial_vowel_plan}. The second agent response is {partial_consonant_plan}. Keep actions of vowel and consonant agents distinct in the PDDL by naming or typing. Ensure the domain models constraints: only top blocks movable, moves place a block onto another block or onto the table, and each agent is restricted to vowels or consonants. Provide the final PDDL domain and problem that achieves the public goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Think step by step.
